usbank.title: US Bancorp Inc
usbank.subtitle: Information Security Specialist
usbank.desc:
• Used Python and SQL to provide analytics and metrics from data sourced from several identity and access management tools used by the Bank.
  • Designed and implemented dynamic reporting daashboards (in Scala and NodeJS) to replace manually created CSV/Excel reports.
  • Contributed to product and security development of the Bank's implementation of Office365/Microsoft Azure.
  • Designed and implemented a NoSQL (MongoDB) solution for tracking application account metadata for all Bank applications.

teksystems.title: TekSystems
teksystems.subtitle: IT Contractor
teksystems.desc:
• Used Python to extract, transform and load data from SQL and flat file sources (text, CSV, JSON) into reporting tools used by executive management.
  • Contributed to a code repository of numerical experiments in Matlab
  • Conducted theoretical investigations of closed forms for Green’s functions associated with the 2-parameter family
  • Presented results at:
    • The Joint Mathematics Meetings 2013 in San Diego, CA
    • The Young Mathematicians Conference 2012 at Ohio State University; our abstract was one of 55 accepted out of 110 submitted
    • Brown's 2013 Symposium for Undergraduates in the Mathematical Sciences
  • Research funded by NSF grant DMS-1115392

stthomas.title: University of St. Thomas
stthomas.subtitle: Student Technician
stthomas.desc:
• Assisted students, faculty and staff with both hardware and software administration tasks (account resets, mail/file quotas, etc.)
  • Assisted with the desgin of SSRS/SSIS packages to present data from a SQL database tracking loanable technology assets (laptops, projectors, etc.)

stthomas.title: University of St. Thomas
stthomas.subtitle: B.A. in Economics—B.A. in Political Science
stthomas.desc:
Selected Coursework:
  • Econometrics
  • Macroeconomic Theory
  • Econometrics and Computer Science
  • Mathematical Economics
  • Game Theory
  • Cryptography
  • Programming with Data Structures and Algorithms
  • Political Behavior
  • Linear Algebra
  • Cybersecurity and International Relations

spark.label: Coming soon
spark.title: Twitter Sentiment Analysis Using Apache Flume and Spark
spark.desc: An implementation of Apache Flume, Hive and Spark to use collect and analyze Twitter posts.

splitr.label: Coming soon
splitr.title: Splitr.co
splitr.desc: A web app to divide things fairly among friends

resume.title: This Resume
resume.desc: As a way of getting familiar with the Node + CoffeeScript + Express + Jade + Less + Bootstrap stack, I built this resume page as an open-source Node app. The app renders resume content stored in a .JSON file. Check out the repo on github.

usbintern.title: U.S. Bank Internship Program
usbintern.subtitle: Mentor
usbintern.desc:
• Helped kickstart the intern program, both as an intern in Summer 2012 and as an alumni mentoring new interns each year.
  • Collaborated with the college recruiment group within the Bank to expand the internship program from IT-only interns to a internship covering all Bank departments.
  • Assisted with conducting interviews with potential intern candidates.
  • Help ensure the program runs smoothly during the summer and serve as a point of contact for any intern questions related to security, the program itself, or otherwise.

usbiamconnect.title: U.S. Bank IAM Connect
usbiamconnect.subtitle: Application Development Advisor
usbiamconnect.desc:
• IAM Connect is virtual team of developers/engineers working in both security and other development groups throughout the Bank.
  • Worked as an identity and access (IAM) advisor for the group to help foster robust communities of practice with respect to developing secure applications using the Bank's existing IAM infrastructure.
  • Assisted as point-of-contact for researching and developing proof-of-concepts related to new IAM technologies.
